Project.name: Employee Admin Demo for Objective C
Project.Description: This demo illustrates techniques for performing routine maintenance operations in a PureMVC-based ObjectiveC application.
Project.ReleaseNotes: Changes in Version 1.1 * Release for PureMVC / ObjectiveC 1.1 / iPhone SDK 3.0 * Dot notation no longer works Features in Version 1.0 * A port of the classic EmployeeAdmin Demo for ActionScript3 * Originally implemented in Flex for a desktop-sized web browser, this port has been artfully reconceived by Brian to fit the iPhone mobile form factor, where transition into sub-screens is necessary.
Project.Installation: Installation From the archive * Download the latest source code archive. * Unzip the source code zip to any folder on your disk. (for instance: ~/Dev) * You will see a Demo_ObjectiveC_UIKit_EmployeeAdmin_X_Y (where X_Y is version) source folder. (for instance: ~/Dev/Demo_ObjectiveC_UIKit_EmployeeAdmin_X_Y ) From the Repository * Use your favorite SVN client to retrieve the latest source code release from the repository. Examine the Contents * The source code: src/org/puremvc/objectivec/... * The PureMVC static library used with the project: lib/PureMVC/PureMVC_ObjectiveC_X_Y.a * The header files for use with the static library: lib/PureMVC/headers Setup, Build, and Run the Demo using XCode Create the Project * Create a new XCode Project called EmployeeAdmin. * Make sure to choose the template: iPhone OS : Application : Window-Based Application Add the PureMVC Static Library * From the Groups & Files pane, * Under the target EmployeeAdmin, * Right click on the Link Binary With Libraries folder * Select Add -> Existing Files... * Browse and Add the PureMVC static library ( i.e. ~/Dev/Demo_ObjectiveC_UIKit_EmployeeAdmin_X_Y/lib/PureMVC/PureMVC_ObjectiveC_X_Y.a ) Add the PureMVC Headers * From the Groups & Files pane, * Double click the EmployeeAdmin target... * ...or right click and select Get Info * Click on the Build tab. * Under the setting, Header Search Paths, * Add the path to the PureMVC headers ( i.e. ~/Dev/Demo_ObjectiveC_UIKit_EmployeeAdmin_X_Y/lib/PureMVC/headers ) Add the Source Folder * From the Groups & Files pane, * Right click on top level EmployeeAdmin project folder * Select Add -> Existing Files... * Browse and Add the project source folder ( i.e. ~/Dev/Demo_ObjectiveC_UIKit_EmployeeAdmin_X_Y/src ) Add the EmployeeAdminAppDelegate.m Open the automatically generated EmployeeAdminAppDelegate.m in XCode editing window and update the code as follows: #import "EmployeeAdminAppDelegate.h" #import "ApplicationFacade.h" #import "EmployeeAdmin.h" @implementation EmployeeAdminAppDelegate @synthesize window; - (void)applicationDidFinishLaunching:(UIApplication *)application { EmployeeAdmin *employeeAdmin = [[[EmployeeAdmin alloc] initWithFrame:[window frame]] autorelease]; [[ApplicationFacade getInstance] startup:employeeAdmin]; [window addSubview:employeeAdmin]; [window makeKeyAndVisible]; } // end Build the Project * From the Build File menu, * Choose Build and Go
